Sure! Here are the chemical entities mentioned in the paragraph:

1. DDAVP: This stands for "desmopressin acetate," which is a synthetic version of the hormone vasopressin (also known as antidiuretic hormone or ADH). DDAVP has antidiuretic action, meaning it helps to reduce urine production by the kidneys.
2. AVP: This stands for "arginine vasopressin," which is the natural form of the hormone vasopressin. AVP has both antidiuretic and vasopressor effects, meaning it can reduce urine production and also constrict blood vessels to increase blood pressure.

So, in summary, the two chemical entities mentioned in the paragraph are:

1. DDAVP (desmopressin acetate)
2. AVP (arginine vasopressin)
